subject: Law
title: The Amendment Process Itself
description: A fast breakdown of The Amendment Process Itself for builders.

hook.text: Over 11,000 amendments have been proposed in Congress. Only 27 have been ratified. The bar is deliberately high.

buildup.text: Article V requires a two-thirds vote in both chambers of Congress, then ratification by three-fourths of states.

discovery.text: There's a second path: a constitutional convention called by two-thirds of state legislatures. It's never been used.

twist.text: The difficulty is intentional. The founders wanted change to require broad consensus, not passing moods.

climax.text: This rigidity keeps the Constitution stable but also means injustices can persist for generations.

punchline.text: Hard to change by design. That's the feature and the flaw.

quiz.question: How many states must ratify a proposed amendment?
